p: Results: A total of 42 trauma patients were admitted during this 9 month-period and 25 patients developed at least one NI. Infected patients and non-infected one was comparable concerning gravity, and mortality. Infected patients needed more transfusions than non-infected ones (Table 11). Infected patients were mostly associated with head trauma (73.8 %) and chest trauma (76.19 %). Ventilatory acquired pneumonia was the most common NI (73.8 %). The most common pathogens found were Klebsiella Pneumoniae 31 %, E Coli 17 % and Pseudomonas Aeroginosa 8.5 %. Patients with NI have had more invasive devices.
